thread.title: Flavor Flav pleads guilty over traffic stop while driving to mom's funeral | Entertainment & Showbiz from CTV News
thread.title_full: Flavor Flav pleads guilty over traffic stop while driving to mom's funeral | Entertainment & Showbiz from CTV News

author: The Associated Press
title: Flavor Flav pleads guilty over traffic stop while driving to mom's funeral | Entertainment & Showbiz from CTV News
text:
MINEOLA, N.Y. -- Entertainer Flavor Flav has pleaded guilty in suburban New York to one count of unlicensed aggravated operation of a motor vehicle.
He was arrested in January 2014 while racing to his mother's funeral on Long Island.
A judge in Nassau Criminal Court on Tuesday sentenced Flav to time served, essentially the time he was in custody following the arrest. He also must pay a fine of a little over $3,600.
Prosecutors had wanted a sentence of six months as part of a plea deal.
Flav's real name is William Drayton. He thanked his attorney and a state trooper who took him to his mother's graveside service after his arrest.
He was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2013 with the rap group Public Enemy.
Related Stories Flavor Flav fires 2nd lawyer in New York traffic case
